Authors: Dimitar B Bojantchev, R Michael Davis
Title:
Cortinarius flavodryophilus sp. nov. Â– a common Phlegmacium
under oaks in California
Abstract:
A new Cortinarius species (subgenus Phlegmacium)
associated with oaks in California is described. Cortinarius
flavodryophilus is a commonly encountered representative of the Fulvoid
Bulbopodiums and is characterized by predominantly light to dark yellow
colors, distinctly emarginated bulb, weak alkali reaction and
association with oaks. Based on phylogenetic analysis of nrITS
sequences, it is placed in the Pseudoglaucopus/Humolens clade.
